page.title: 13THE PENSIONER 1
page.content: Pensioners in Gwaelod-y-Garth tend to contribute more to the local community than the other inhabitants of the village. Considering their age and general well being, they are amazingly active and remain the group most likely to get things done in the village. Gwaelod-y-Garth itself is a small village perched on the mountain above Taffs Well. Most of the young people who have recently moved into the village own cars and find it easy to travvel to the large shopping areas such as Cardiff or Pontypridd. The pensioners however are ill served by the local public transport. The bus service is very infrequent and the pensioners feel they are in great danger of becoming prisoners in their own homes.
